name: Fashion & Apparel
description: Fashion and apparel e-commerce requires sophisticated ad analytics to track seasonal trends, size returns, and multi-channel attribution across visually-driven platforms.
challenges: Size and fit issues affect conversion
Fast fashion trends require agile campaigns
strategies: Use CAPI to track post-return revenue
Build lookalike audiences from low-return customers
Invest in video content showcasing fit and fabric
Retarget cart abandoners with size guides
Test TikTok and Instagram Reels for discovery
caseStudySnippet: Fashion brands using metricx see 23% better ROAS accuracy by factoring in returns.

faqs.question: How do I account for returns in ROAS?
faqs.answer: True ROAS should subtract returns. With metricx, Shopify integration automatically adjusts revenue for returned items, giving you accurate profitability.

faqs.question: Which platform works best for fashion?
faqs.answer: Meta (Instagram) and TikTok drive discovery. Google Shopping captures high-intent searches. Use all three for full-funnel coverage.

metricxFeature: Return-adjusted ROAS tracking with Shopify refund data integration

name: Beauty & Cosmetics
description: Beauty and cosmetics brands thrive on visual platforms with strong UGC and influencer content, requiring analytics that track both new customer acquisition and replenishment cycles.
challenges: Long consideration cycles for premium products
strategies: Track LTV by acquisition channel, not just first purchase
Measure influencer campaigns with unique tracking
Use quiz funnels for personalized product matching
caseStudySnippet: Beauty brands see 35% higher ROAS when optimizing for LTV instead of first-purchase CPA.

faqs.question: How should I measure influencer campaigns?
faqs.answer: Use unique discount codes, UTM parameters, and branded landing pages for each influencer. Track both direct sales and assisted conversions in the attribution window.

faqs.question: How do I track subscription revenue from ads?
faqs.answer: metricx tracks subscription orders from Shopify, letting you see which ad campaigns drive recurring revenue, not just one-time purchases.

metricxFeature: LTV-based optimization with subscription revenue tracking

name: Health & Wellness
description: Health and wellness e-commerce includes supplements, fitness equipment, and wellness products, requiring compliant advertising and trust-building content.
challenges: Strict advertising restrictions on health claims
strategies: Focus on education over direct claims
Build email lists for compliant direct communication
Track subscription churn by acquisition source
Use testimonials and social proof heavily
Invest in content marketing for organic traffic
caseStudySnippet: Supplement brands achieve 40% lower churn when acquiring customers through educational content vs direct response.

faqs.question: How do I advertise supplements compliantly?
faqs.answer: Focus on ingredient benefits, lifestyle imagery, and testimonials. Avoid medical claims. Each platform has specific policies - review Meta's and Google's health product guidelines.

faqs.question: How should I track subscription LTV?
faqs.answer: metricx calculates LTV cohorts by acquisition source, showing which campaigns bring subscribers who stay longest.

metricxFeature: Subscription LTV tracking with churn prediction by acquisition channel

name: Home & Garden
description: Home and garden e-commerce involves high-consideration purchases with longer buying cycles, requiring attribution that captures the full customer journey.
challenges: High AOV but lower purchase frequency
strategies: Retarget across the entire consideration period
Invest heavily in Pinterest for discovery
Create room visualizers and planning tools
Optimize for add-to-cart, not just purchases
caseStudySnippet: Home brands using 30-day attribution see 60% more attributed conversions than 7-day windows.

faqs.question: Why do my Meta Ads show low ROAS for home products?
faqs.answer: Home purchases have long consideration cycles. Meta's default 7-day window misses conversions. Use longer attribution windows and view-through attribution.

faqs.question: Is Pinterest worth it for home products?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Pinterest users plan home projects months in advance. CPMs are lower and purchase intent is high.

name: Food & Beverage
description: Food and beverage DTC brands face unique challenges with perishability, subscription models, and repeat purchase patterns that require specialized analytics.
strategies: Optimize for subscription sign-ups, not one-time
caseStudySnippet: DTC food brands break even on first order but generate 4x return through subscription LTV.

faqs.question: Should I acquire at a loss on first order?
faqs.answer: If your subscription data shows strong retention, yes. Track CAC payback period. Most food brands recover CAC by order 2-3.

faqs.question: How do I reduce subscription churn?
faqs.answer: Analyze churn by acquisition channel. Some sources (discount-heavy) churn 2x faster. Focus ad spend on quality cohorts.

metricxFeature: Subscription cohort analysis with CAC payback tracking

name: Electronics & Tech
description: Electronics and tech products require detailed product comparison content and analytics that track high-consideration, research-heavy purchase journeys.
strategies: Capture search traffic for product comparisons
caseStudySnippet: Electronics brands see 50% of conversions from visitors who researched 3+ times before purchase.

faqs.question: How do I compete with Amazon for electronics?
faqs.answer: Focus on unique products, bundles, expert service, and warranty. Track customers who research on Amazon but buy from you.

faqs.question: What attribution window for electronics?
faqs.answer: Use 30-60 day click windows. Electronics purchases often take 2-4 weeks of research before conversion.

metricxFeature: Research-to-purchase path tracking with multi-touch attribution

name: Jewelry & Accessories
description: Jewelry and accessories e-commerce combines impulse purchases (costume jewelry) with high-consideration luxury items, requiring segmented analytics approaches.
challenges: Wide price range requires segmented strategy
caseStudySnippet: Jewelry brands see 3x ROAS during gift-giving seasons compared to off-peak periods.

faqs.question: How do I track gift purchases?
faqs.answer: Implement gift options at checkout and track separately. Gift purchasers have different LTV patterns than self-purchasers.

faqs.question: When should I scale ad spend for jewelry?
faqs.answer: Begin scaling 4-6 weeks before major holidays. Competition peaks last 2 weeks - consider securing inventory of winning creatives early.

metricxFeature: Seasonal demand forecasting with gift purchase tracking

name: Pet Products
description: Pet products e-commerce benefits from highly passionate customers with strong repeat purchase patterns and subscription potential.
strategies: Use pet photos in UGC campaigns
caseStudySnippet: Pet brands with subscription models see 5x higher LTV than one-time purchase customers.

faqs.question: How do I compete with Chewy and Amazon?
faqs.answer: Focus on premium/specialty products, personalization, and community. Track customers who value expertise over lowest price.

faqs.question: What's the best targeting for pet products?
faqs.answer: Use interest-based (pet owners) + behavior (pet supply purchasers) + life event (new pet adoption) targeting in combination.

metricxFeature: Subscription cohort tracking with reorder cycle analysis

name: Sports & Outdoor
description: Sports and outdoor e-commerce serves passionate enthusiasts with specific needs, requiring analytics that track both seasonal patterns and activity-based segments.
challenges: Size and fit for performance gear
strategies: Time campaigns to seasons and events
caseStudySnippet: Outdoor brands see 80% of annual revenue in 4 months - analytics must plan for seasonality.

faqs.question: How do I plan for seasonal sports demand?
faqs.answer: Build 12-month demand calendars by sport. Start campaigns 6-8 weeks before peak seasons. Reserve budget for shoulder seasons.

faqs.question: Should I run ads in the off-season?
faqs.answer: Yes, but shift objectives. Off-season is for list building, content engagement, and acquiring deal-hunters at lower CPAs.

metricxFeature: Seasonal demand planning with year-over-year comparison

name: Baby & Kids
description: Baby and kids e-commerce serves parents through distinct life stages, requiring analytics that track the evolving needs of growing families.
challenges: Rapid product aging out (kids grow fast)
Wide age range with different needs
caseStudySnippet: Baby brands that track life-stage progression see 3x higher LTV by age-appropriate upselling.

faqs.question: How do I acquire expecting parents?
faqs.answer: Target pregnancy and parenting interests, registry-related searches, and life-event signals. Offer registry or welcome boxes.

faqs.question: How should I track LTV for baby products?
faqs.answer: LTV is highly age-dependent. Track by child's birth date and measure purchases through each stage (infant, toddler, preschool).

metricxFeature: Life-stage tracking with age-based cohort analysis

name: Luxury Goods
description: Luxury e-commerce requires sophisticated attribution for high-value, long-consideration purchases with affluent audiences.
strategies: Track store visits from digital campaigns
Invest in brand storytelling over direct response
Use contextual targeting for brand-safe placement
caseStudySnippet: Luxury brands see 40% of conversions attributed to touchpoints 30+ days prior to purchase.

faqs.question: What attribution model for luxury?
faqs.answer: Use linear or time-decay models with 90-day windows. Last-click dramatically undervalues awareness campaigns for luxury.

faqs.question: How do I target affluent audiences?
faqs.answer: Use income targeting where available, interest-based (luxury brands, travel), and lookalikes from your VIP customers.

name: Subscription Boxes
description: Subscription box e-commerce requires analytics focused on CAC payback, churn prediction, and cohort lifetime value optimization.
challenges: Acquiring at a loss on first box
strategies: Optimize for LTV, not first-box ROAS
caseStudySnippet: Subscription boxes that track churn by source reduce CAC payback by 30% by shifting spend.

faqs.question: What CAC is acceptable for subscription boxes?
faqs.answer: CAC should payback within 2-3 boxes (3-4 months). If average LTV is $200 over 5 boxes, CAC under $50 is healthy.

faqs.question: How do I reduce subscription churn?
faqs.answer: Analyze churn timing (month 2-3 is critical), offer pause options, personalize boxes, and identify at-risk subscribers early.

metricxFeature: Cohort LTV tracking with churn prediction by acquisition source
